channel.title: Bolivia – Vamos a Bailar
channel.description: A traveling blog for discovering South America

item.title: Bolivian specialties
item.dc:creator: eric
item.description:
Some of my nice culinary experiments Food Charquekan Dried beef, salt cheese, egg and white corn. Pique macho A meal with pieces of beef, fried potatoes, onion, sausage, tomatoes, peppers, spicy peppers and egg. Aji de Fideo Meal with pasta, chopped beef, vegetables Picante de Lengua Beef tongue. The “Picante” is the type of way […]

The post Bolivian specialties appeared first on Vamos a Bailar.

item.title: Death Road on bike: From 4700 meters to 1600 meters
item.dc:creator: eric
item.description:
The Death Road is the previous main road between the Altiplano and the Amazonian jungle. Made of earth, narrow, wet, everything for creating a dangerous road. Many accidents occurred for the condition reasons or for the craziness of the Bolivian drivers. Now, a newly paved road replaces this old one. The top The initial part […]

The post Death Road on bike: From 4700 meters to 1600 meters appeared first on Vamos a Bailar.

item.title: Huayna Potosi: Get closer to the stars at 6088 meters
item.dc:creator: eric
item.description:
Huayna Potosi, a mountain close to La Paz, a mountain with a summit at 6088 meters, a mountain I am going to climb, no, a mountain I climbed. I booked a 3 days tour that took me to the top. Day 1: First Base Camp Arriving We left La Paz early in order to be […]

The post Huayna Potosi: Get closer to the stars at 6088 meters appeared first on Vamos a Bailar.

item.title: Toro Toro: In the footsteps of Dinosaurs
item.dc:creator: eric
item.description:
Toro Toro City The city of Toro Toro was located 5 hours bus ride from the main city Cochabamba. The city was very small and simple, they got electricity 10 years ago. Still now, lots of people are doing the laundry in the river. As an anecdote, I found only one washing machine in the […]

The post Toro Toro: In the footsteps of Dinosaurs appeared first on Vamos a Bailar.

item.title: From Tupiza to the Uyuni salt flat
item.dc:creator: eric
item.description:
Tour I did the tour with Natural Adventure, the agency down the hostel. We were one driver, one cooker (we never saw, but she cooked well!!), and 5 tourists. 4 French and 1 Italian, so we spoke mostly French in the car. Lots of images are better for living this trip. Day 1 – South […]

The post From Tupiza to the Uyuni salt flat appeared first on Vamos a Bailar.

item.title: Tupiza on red rocks
item.dc:creator: eric
item.description:
Arriving late I left Sucre in the morning, early. My first bus took me until Potosi, where I changed midday for another bus. This second and last bus drove me until Tupiza. The second bus is almost 2 times longer than the first one: 5 hours. Hopefully, the landscapes are really beautiful. This will be […]

The post Tupiza on red rocks appeared first on Vamos a Bailar.

item.title: Into the mines of Potosi
item.dc:creator: eric
item.description:
Potosi is a high city around 4000 meters high overhung by the Cerro Rico. Cerro Rico is the 4500 meters high mountain that overtakes everything around. Inside stands the mine, previously renowned by the Spanish for the silver they extracted, now for the hard work it is. 3 hours inside the hell On the road […]

The post Into the mines of Potosi appeared first on Vamos a Bailar.

item.title: My crush on Sucre
item.dc:creator: eric
item.description:
After being sick when I arrived, I continued to suffer due to the altitude. Sucre is located at 2,700 meters high. At the beginning, I got a headache and difficulties to eat. Only after three weeks of being at this altitude or higher, I could be normal again. Aside from this trouble, I was able […]

The post My crush on Sucre appeared first on Vamos a Bailar.

item.title: Santa Cruz: my first contact with the Bolivian culture
item.dc:creator: eric
item.description:
Welcome to Bolivia I arrived by plane from Sao Paulo. This was a huge shock between the messy city of Sao Paulo and the quietness of Santa Cruz. The country is cheap as a lot of people told me. However, it is also far less developed that the other countries I have visited so far. […]

The post Santa Cruz: my first contact with the Bolivian culture appeared first on Vamos a Bailar.
